text:
Marisa Anna Solinas (30 May 1939 – 13 February 2019), best known as Marisa Solinas, was an Italian actress and singer-songwriter. She was born in Genoa. She starred in one of the four episodes of "Boccaccio '70";. In the same year she appeared in Bernardo Bertolucci's movie debut, "La commare secca" and acted on stage in "Fogli d'album".
She was also a singer, and published two albums and several singles, one of these released by La voce del padrone.
She died on 13 February 2019 in Rome from lymphoma at the age of 79.
